title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.30 | 19-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: In this session, we will be discussing from the 30th verse of the 11th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and an introduction to the verse that will be discussed from Srimad Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: The personality of Godhead means one who is full with all power, all energy, all opulences, all beauties, all knowledge, and all renunciation.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the meaning of the verse, focusing on the opulence of Lord Krishna and the description of his palaces, drawing from Srila Prabhupada's purport and defining the term Bhagavan.

segments.key_quote: When the great sage Narada heard that Lord Krishna had married 16,000 wives after he had killed the demon Narakasura, Narada was astonished.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of Narada's visit to Dwarka, describing the city's beauty, the palaces of Krishna's wives, and the overall opulence, based on the 10th canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: The great sage Narada entered one of these houses and saw that the pillars were made of coral and the ceilings were bedecked with jewels.
segments.summary: The speaker continues the description of Krishna's palaces, focusing on the intricate details of the architecture, decorations, and the service provided by numerous maidservants and manservants.

segments.key_quote: This material world is filled with miseries. It's the nature of this material world. We don't belong here.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the opulence of the spiritual world with the suffering of the material world, emphasizing that Krishna's opulence is meant to attract conditioned souls and that material pleasures are not real.

segments.key_quote: Krishna invites us. Please come to the spiritual world. And simply by chanting Hare Krishna and perfecting our devotional service, we can immediately transfer ourselves to the spiritual world.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by inviting listeners to seek spiritual bliss with Krishna, highlighting Krishna's availability to all and the power of devotional service, particularly chanting Hare Krishna, to attain the spiritual world.
